column4: has anyone in here ever used the real vnc java applet from a web browser to connect to there box via vino?
shouldn't be a problem
well i didnt know if it was feature of just realvnc or vino as well
cause i cant seem to get it working, then again, i dont have the firefox java plugin installed yet eitther, cant remeber how
all i get when i try to connect is RFB 003.007
so can ya help?
all I can say is that I've used vino with other machine vncvieiwer... and I didn't have a problem eventhough vncviewer I used is quite old (at a RH7.3 machine)
no im trying to use the java applet via a browser to connect, it uses something different i think
I tried java applet long time ago and didn't require anything special as far as I recall...
except of java, obviously
however it was slower compared to standalone vncviewer
you are right, it doesn't work
probably vino does not offer the java applet
You are right again, I'm sorry
normal vncserver should be enough
vncserver is not at ubuntu packages?
btw, I'm getting same message for vncserver
ok thx
perhaps there is some configuration option for that
but where, i could never find a conf for vino
I don't know if vino depends on vncserver; if such, probably it is matter of vncserver configuration...
nope, vino seems to be independent from vncserver
